author: Jacob Gershman
title: As Legislative Sessions Wind Down, Statehouses to Settle Fate of Gun Bills
text:
As statehouses across the country approach the end of their legislative sessions in the coming weeks, advocates on either side of the gun debate are pushing hard to get their measures across the finish line.
Already, some states including Florida and Vermont have passed measures to toughen access to firearms, though it’s hard to know if others will follow suit. Many proposed bills could just be left dangling when the sessions end in the spring and early summer.
... RELATED VIDEO Can Gun Makers Be Held Liable for Mass Shootings? Could Remington Outdoor, the maker of the AR-15 style rifle used in the Sandy Hook shooting, be held responsible for the deaths of children killed there? Parents of the victims are using a 1977 lawsuit about a slingshot to argue that they are liable. WSJ’s Spencer Macnaughton explains. Photo: AP
